places_to_visit.name: Salar de Uyuni
places_to_visit.description: Salar de Uyuni is the world’s largest salt flat, covering over 10,000 square kilometers. The vast, white landscape is formed by a thick crust of salt that creates a mirror effect during the rainy season, offering a surreal and breathtaking experience. The salt flat is surrounded by volcanoes and is home to unique wildlife and colorful lagoons.

places_to_visit.name: Isla Incahuasi
places_to_visit.description: Isla Incahuasi, also known as Fish Island, is a striking island in the middle of Salar de Uyuni. It is covered with giant cacti and offers stunning views of the surrounding salt flat. The island is a popular spot for hiking and photography.

places_to_visit.name: Laguna Colorada
places_to_visit.description: Laguna Colorada, or Red Lagoon, is a high-altitude lake known for its striking red color caused by algae and mineral deposits. It is home to large flocks of flamingos and offers picturesque views of the Andes mountains.

places_to_visit.name: Laguna Verde
places_to_visit.description: Laguna Verde, or Green Lagoon, is a beautiful high-altitude lake known for its striking green color, which is caused by the high levels of copper in the water. It is situated at the base of the Licancabur Volcano and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape.

Prepare for high altitudes and stay hydrated.
Bring plenty of sunscreen and sunglasses to protect against the intense sun reflection.
